text: {"fixed_xml":"<ITEM><ITEM_NO>11.</ITEM_NO> <SELLER>Bey Herrn Daniel Hag dem Buchbinder</SELLER> <INTRO>Sind folgende Bücher, in nachgesetztem Preis zu verkauffen:</INTRO> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Justi Lipsii</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Epistolarum Centuriae complet</TITLE> <FORMAT>4to.</FORMAT> <IMPRINT>apud Plautin.</IMPRINT> <PRICE>1. Gulden 36. xr.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Politicorum Libri</TITLE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Monita</TITLE> <VOLUME>8e Exempla politica</VOLUME></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR> <TITLE>De Magnitudine Romana</TITLE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR> <TITLE>De Constantia</TITLE> <FORMAT>4to.</FORMAT> <IMPRINT>ibid.</IMPRINT> <PRICE>fl. 1. xr. 36.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR> <TITLE>De Militia Romana cum An. fig.</TITLE> <FORMAT>4to</FORMAT> <IMPRINT>ibid.</IMPRINT> <PRICE>fl. 1. xr. 30.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Poliorecticon de Machinis, Tormentis, Telis cum An. fig.</TITLE> <FORMAT>4to.</FORMAT> <PRICE>fl. 1. xr. 12.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR> <TITLE>De Amphitheatro</TITLE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR> <TITLE>De Amphitheatris extra Romam, cum An. fig.</TITLE> <FORMAT>4to</FORMAT> <IMPRINT>ibid.</IMPRINT> <PRICE>30. xr.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Dissert. apud Principes se C. Plinii Panegyricus cum Commentar.</TITLE> <FORMAT>4to</FORMAT> <IMPRINT>ibid.</IMPRINT> <PRICE>48. xr.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>C. Corn. Taciti & Velleji Paterculi</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Opera cum Lipsii Commentariis</TITLE> <FORMAT>Fol.</FORMAT> <NOTE>gros</NOTE> <IMPRINT>ibid.</IMPRINT> <PRICE>fl. 3.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Ovidii</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Opera cum Notis integris W. Heinsii & variorum</TITLE> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> <VOLUME>3. Theil</VOLUME> <PLACE>Lugd.</PLACE> <PRICE>fl. 7. xr. 12.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Gotthard Heideggers</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Kleinere teutsche Schrifften</TITLE> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> <YEAR>1732</YEAR> <PRICE>30. ß.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><TITLE>Delicia Urbis Bernae</TITLE> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> <YEAR>1732</YEAR> <PRICE>13. ß.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>J. J. Scheuchzers</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Vernunfft-mässige Undersuchung des Baades zu Baaden, mit Kupfferen</TITLE> <FORMAT>4to.</FORMAT> <YEAR>1732</YEAR> <PRICE>11. ß.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>J. J. Scheuchzers</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Vernunfft-mässige Undersuchung des Baades zu Baaden, ohne Kupffer</TITLE> <FORMAT>4to.</FORMAT> <YEAR>1732</YEAR> <PRICE>4. Batzen.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Johann Milton</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Verlust des Paradieses</TITLE> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> <YEAR>1732</YEAR> <PRICE>14. ß.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><TITLE>Paragone della Poesia Tragica d'Italia con quella di Francia</TITLE> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> <YEAR>1732</YEAR> <PRICE>5. Batzen.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>J. J. Breitingeri</AUTHOR> <TITLE>In versus obscuriss. Persii diatribe historico-literaria</TITLE> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> <YEAR>1723</YEAR> <PRICE>1. Batzen.</PRICE></BIBL> <BIBL><TITLE>Discurse der Mahleren</TITLE> <VOLUME>4. Theil</VOLUME> <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT> <YEAR>1731</YEAR> <PRICE>16. ß.</PRICE></BIBL></ITEM>","number_of_corrections":24,"explanation":"1) Wrapped the leading enumeration and seller phrase into semantic tags: added <ITEM_NO>11.</ITEM_NO>, <SELLER>…</SELLER>, and <INTRO>…</INTRO> inside <ITEM>. 2) Closed the first <ITEM> tag with a matching </ITEM> at the end and ensured only one top-level element, making the XML well-formed. 3) Normalized the garbled Unicode for 'Bücher' and 'Preis' and similar words, replacing mis-decoded characters with proper Latin letters; no extra tags added but textual cleanup. 4) Replaced every inconsistent price tag <PRIZE> with the normalized tag <PRICE> to have a single price element; also corrected the one occurrence of <PRICE> that was already present so all prices use the same tag name. 5) For the first entry, moved 'apud Plautin.' into a new <IMPRINT> element to separate imprint from price. 6) Split the run-on sequence 'Politicorum Libri. Monita 8e Exempla politica. De Magnitudine Romana.' into three distinct <BIBL> records, each with its own <TITLE> (and for the second also <VOLUME>), assigning 'Ejusd.' as the implied author for the latter two via <AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR>. 7) Created an <AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR> element for the previously author-less 'De Magnitudine Romana' and 'Monita' entries, reflecting that they are by Lipsius. 8) Corrected the title 'De Magnirudine Romana' to the historically standard 'De Magnitudine Romana' to fix an obvious OCR error. 9) For items marked with '-ibid.' after the format, captured 'ibid.' as <IMPRINT>ibid.</IMPRINT> instead of leaving it as free text, improving structure (applied to affected Lipsius titles and the Tacitus volume). 10) For 'C. Corn. Taciti & Velleji Paterculi Opera… groüß Fol. ibid.', captured 'gros' (gros/groß) as a descriptive <NOTE> element, leaving <FORMAT>Fol.</FORMAT> for the size, and 'ibid.' in <IMPRINT>. 11) Changed ampersands '&' to '&' and apostrophes within attribute-like text to character entities where necessary (e.g. d'Italia) to ensure XML validity. 12) Regularized capitalization of Latin titles where clearly garbled, e.g. 'Magnirudine'→'Magnitudine', 'Opera cum Notis Integris'→'Opera cum Notis integris' (maintaining a consistent style). 13) Converted the garbled 'groü Fol.' into separated <NOTE>gros</NOTE> and <FORMAT>Fol.</FORMAT> while keeping the meaning. 14) Replaced mis-decoded 'ß' signs that appeared as garbled sequences (\\u221a\\u00fc etc.) with 'ß.' in prices and some German words ('teutsche', etc.), normalizing the orthography. 15) For year values, removed trailing periods inside <YEAR> to keep <YEAR> as a clean numeric field (e.g. <YEAR>1732.</YEAR> → <YEAR>1732</YEAR>). 16) Removed stray commas and periods that improperly followed closing tags (e.g. '</TITLE>,'), relocating punctuation within the text where appropriate or dropping redundant punctuation to keep XML clean. 17) For 'Dissert. apud Principes Se C.Plinii Pane-Gyricus…', normalized spacing and hyphenation to 'se C. Plinii Panegyricus' to reflect standard Latin and remove OCR hyphenation. 18) Corrected 'Verlust des Parabieses' to 'Verlust des Paradieses' (German for 'Paradise Lost'), a clear OCR error, leaving author as Johann Milton. 19) Corrected 'Paragone della Pobsia Tragica dtalia conquella di Francia' to 'Paragone della Poesia Tragica d'Italia con quella di Francia', regularizing Italian spelling and spacing. 20) Corrected 'Vernunfft-m§ßige Undersuchung' garbling to 'Vernunfft-mässige Undersuchung', normalizing the OCR of umlauts and ß. 21) Regularized 'J. J. Breitingeri in Versus obscurciss. Persii diarribe Historico Literaria' to 'In versus obscuriss. Persii diatribe historico-literaria', preserving the essential wording but fixing 'obscurciss.'→'obscuriss.' and 'diarribe'→'diatribe', with hyphenated compound for consistency. 22) Ensured that the nested <BIBL> elements that had been improperly opened inside one another are now separate sibling <BIBL> entries by closing each before starting the next, which fixes structural nesting errors. 23) Standardized language of FORMAT entries (e.g. '4to', '4to.', '8vo.', 'Fol.') and removed extraneous trailing hyphens that had functioned as layout separators in the print source. 24) Verified that all opened tags (<ITEM>, <BIBL>, <AUTHOR>, <TITLE>, <FORMAT>, <VOLUME>, <PLACE>, <YEAR>, <PRICE>, <NOTE>, <IMPRINT>, <INTRO>, <SELLER>, <ITEM_NO>) are properly closed and that there are no overlapping or mismatched tags, producing syntactically valid XML suitable for downstream processing."}

parsed.explanation: 1) Wrapped the leading enumeration and seller phrase into semantic tags: added <ITEM_NO>11.</ITEM_NO>, <SELLER>…</SELLER>, and <INTRO>…</INTRO> inside <ITEM>. 2) Closed the first <ITEM> tag with a matching </ITEM> at the end and ensured only one top-level element, making the XML well-formed. 3) Normalized the garbled Unicode for 'Bücher' and 'Preis' and similar words, replacing mis-decoded characters with proper Latin letters; no extra tags added but textual cleanup. 4) Replaced every inconsistent price tag <PRIZE> with the normalized tag <PRICE> to have a single price element; also corrected the one occurrence of <PRICE> that was already present so all prices use the same tag name. 5) For the first entry, moved 'apud Plautin.' into a new <IMPRINT> element to separate imprint from price. 6) Split the run-on sequence 'Politicorum Libri. Monita 8e Exempla politica. De Magnitudine Romana.' into three distinct <BIBL> records, each with its own <TITLE> (and for the second also <VOLUME>), assigning 'Ejusd.' as the implied author for the latter two via <AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR>. 7) Created an <AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR> element for the previously author-less 'De Magnitudine Romana' and 'Monita' entries, reflecting that they are by Lipsius. 8) Corrected the title 'De Magnirudine Romana' to the historically standard 'De Magnitudine Romana' to fix an obvious OCR error. 9) For items marked with '-ibid.' after the format, captured 'ibid.' as <IMPRINT>ibid.</IMPRINT> instead of leaving it as free text, improving structure (applied to affected Lipsius titles and the Tacitus volume). 10) For 'C. Corn. Taciti & Velleji Paterculi Opera… groüß Fol. ibid.', captured 'gros' (gros/groß) as a descriptive <NOTE> element, leaving <FORMAT>Fol.</FORMAT> for the size, and 'ibid.' in <IMPRINT>. 11) Changed ampersands '&' to '&' and apostrophes within attribute-like text to character entities where necessary (e.g. d'Italia) to ensure XML validity. 12) Regularized capitalization of Latin titles where clearly garbled, e.g. 'Magnirudine'→'Magnitudine', 'Opera cum Notis Integris'→'Opera cum Notis integris' (maintaining a consistent style). 13) Converted the garbled 'groü Fol.' into separated <NOTE>gros</NOTE> and <FORMAT>Fol.</FORMAT> while keeping the meaning. 14) Replaced mis-decoded 'ß' signs that appeared as garbled sequences (\u221a\u00fc etc.) with 'ß.' in prices and some German words ('teutsche', etc.), normalizing the orthography. 15) For year values, removed trailing periods inside <YEAR> to keep <YEAR> as a clean numeric field (e.g. <YEAR>1732.</YEAR> → <YEAR>1732</YEAR>). 16) Removed stray commas and periods that improperly followed closing tags (e.g. '</TITLE>,'), relocating punctuation within the text where appropriate or dropping redundant punctuation to keep XML clean. 17) For 'Dissert. apud Principes Se C.Plinii Pane-Gyricus…', normalized spacing and hyphenation to 'se C. Plinii Panegyricus' to reflect standard Latin and remove OCR hyphenation. 18) Corrected 'Verlust des Parabieses' to 'Verlust des Paradieses' (German for 'Paradise Lost'), a clear OCR error, leaving author as Johann Milton. 19) Corrected 'Paragone della Pobsia Tragica dtalia conquella di Francia' to 'Paragone della Poesia Tragica d'Italia con quella di Francia', regularizing Italian spelling and spacing. 20) Corrected 'Vernunfft-m§ßige Undersuchung' garbling to 'Vernunfft-mässige Undersuchung', normalizing the OCR of umlauts and ß. 21) Regularized 'J. J. Breitingeri in Versus obscurciss. Persii diarribe Historico Literaria' to 'In versus obscuriss. Persii diatribe historico-literaria', preserving the essential wording but fixing 'obscurciss.'→'obscuriss.' and 'diarribe'→'diatribe', with hyphenated compound for consistency. 22) Ensured that the nested <BIBL> elements that had been improperly opened inside one another are now separate sibling <BIBL> entries by closing each before starting the next, which fixes structural nesting errors. 23) Standardized language of FORMAT entries (e.g. '4to', '4to.', '8vo.', 'Fol.') and removed extraneous trailing hyphens that had functioned as layout separators in the print source. 24) Verified that all opened tags (<ITEM>, <BIBL>, <AUTHOR>, <TITLE>, <FORMAT>, <VOLUME>, <PLACE>, <YEAR>, <PRICE>, <NOTE>, <IMPRINT>, <INTRO>, <SELLER>, <ITEM_NO>) are properly closed and that there are no overlapping or mismatched tags, producing syntactically valid XML suitable for downstream processing.
